metadata.title: CVE-2022-21619 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Editionproduct of Oracle Java SE (component: Security). Supported versions thatare affected are Oracle Java SE: 8u341, 8u345-perf, 11.0.16.1, 17.0.4.1,19; Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition: 20.3.7, 21.3.3 and 22.2.0. Difficultto exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with networkaccess via multiple protocols to compromise Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVMEnterprise Edition. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result inunauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of Oracle Java SE,Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition accessible data. Note: This vulnerabilityapplies to Java deployments, typically in clients running sandboxed JavaWeb Start applications or sandboxed Java applets, that load and rununtrusted code (e.g., code that comes from the internet) and rely on theJava sandbox for security. This vulnerability can also be exploited byusing APIs in the specified Component, e.g., through a web service whichsupplies data to the APIs. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 3.7 (Integrity impacts).CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openjdk-8-demo - 8u352-ga-1
openjdk-8-jdk - 8u352-ga-1
openjdk-8-jdk-headless - 8u352-ga-1
openjdk-8-jre - 8u352-ga-1
openjdk-8-jre-headless - 8u352-ga-1
openjdk-8-jre-zero - 8u352-ga-1
openjdk-8-source - 8u352-ga-1
No subscription required

openjdk-11-demo - 11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2
openjdk-11-jdk - 11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2
openjdk-11-jdk-headless - 11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2
openjdk-11-jre - 11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2
openjdk-11-jre-headless - 11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2
openjdk-11-jre-zero - 11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2
openjdk-11-source - 11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

openjdk-17-demo - 17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1
openjdk-17-jdk - 17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1
openjdk-17-jdk-headless - 17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1
openjdk-17-jre - 17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1
openjdk-17-jre-headless - 17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1
openjdk-17-jre-zero - 17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1
openjdk-17-source - 17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

openjdk-19-demo - 19.0.1+10-1
openjdk-19-jdk - 19.0.1+10-1
openjdk-19-jdk-headless - 19.0.1+10-1
openjdk-19-jre - 19.0.1+10-1
openjdk-19-jre-headless - 19.0.1+10-1
openjdk-19-jre-zero - 19.0.1+10-1
openjdk-19-source - 19.0.1+10-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-8 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8u352-ga-1').
openjdk-lts package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '11.0.17+8-1ubuntu2').
openjdk-17 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '17.0.5+8-2ubuntu1').
openjdk-18: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by openjdk-19').
openjdk-19 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '19.0.1+10-1').
